result.execSummary:
The defendant Serena V Bratz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
--pay all costs and fees

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $961.00] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 19 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or an educational program per the Agent

--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to take all medications only as prescribed by a treating physician)

--no contact with Kevin Gonzalez-Moreno

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for expungement on Count #1 in the new Criminal Complaint only. The Defendant is only eligible if she completes the 18 month Probation term without any holds or ATRs.

--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision and surcharge
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Serena V Bratz

records.addlTxt: Yes- please amend JOC if necessary.
Clerks note to Judge re failure to pay days

[ml] Case called at 2:47PM
Defendant Serena V Bratz in court with attorney Cassi Nelson. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties are recited; Constitutional rights are reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered as to Count #1 in 20CF518 and Count #1 in the new Criminal Complaint; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance is verified.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #2 and #3 in 21CF518. The Court outright dismisses Count #4 outright in file 20CF518.

On Count #1 in file 20CF518, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 18 months. On Count #1 in the new Criminal Complaint, the Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:
--to serve 6 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges. THIS IS A TIME SERVED SENTENCE
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--maintain absolute sobriety (no alcohol, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, and to take all medications only as prescribed by a treating physician)
--attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or an educational program per the Agent
--to comply with DNA sample provision and surcharge
--pay all costs and fees
--no contact with Kevin Gonzalez-Moreno

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for expungement on Count #1 in the new Criminal Complaint only. The Defendant is only eligible if she completes the 18 month Probation term without any holds or ATRs.  The Defendant is not eligible for expungement on Count #1 in file 20CF518.

Separate from the conditions of Probation, the Court orders payment of costs, fees and surcharges through the Clerk of Courts Office. [Clerk calculates this total to be: $961.00] The Court grants the Defendant sixty days to either pay the amount in full or to establish a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts Office.  Non-payment will result in 19 days in Jail with Huber privileges, consecutive.

Felony firearms/Civil Rights warning given

Days credit for time already served: 7 days Count #1 in 20CF518

recess 3:17PM
